text: I would consider that Rapid7

is a cloud native business,
so that means that it's

completely in our DNA to
build things with AWS,
and build it in the cloud.
We started to use Network Firewall mostly

because we had a lot
of different networks.

So we have a relatively
large engineering team,

and that means like what
a lot of different VPCs,
a lot of different environments.

And so we, when the challenge,
when we wanted to simplify

and enhance our security,
like what do we do?
And after we looked at various solutions,

we identified that Network
Firewall was really
the one which simplified this the most.
And then more importantly, also
it was the easiest to roll out.

So it was the combination of ease
of use and then

managing it centrally across these
different environments.
AWS Network Firewall really helps us
protect our customer data.

And if you think about
the different layers of

what you have to do to
protect an environment,

I feel like the network
layer is the basis around.

And using AWS Network Firewall,
it's really a cost efficient

solution to help our
protected environment.

But it also is, I think
a really interesting
solution because it keeps evolving

and you can basically put
additional protections
on top and get their, not only protection,
but also really good visibility.

AWS Network Firewall
has been really awesome
to basically simplify this

and help us to protect
customer's data more efficiently.
